channel.description: A list of all suggestions made for "What should we take out of Ruby?"

item.title: Suggestion from the proposer
item.description: Andrew: do you mean this flip-flop operator? I think that's a good addition to the list!

item.title: Suggestion from Andrew Grimm (@agrimm)
item.description:
I currently use the first five features! ^_^

Are you going to talk about the flip flop operator as well?

item.title: Suggestion from the proposer
item.description:
Hi Filip, thanks for your suggestion. I'd like to try to persuade you otherwise! I know that some of my ideas might be impractical or a hard sell, but I think that's what makes them provocative and interesting to discuss.

I think there are some architectural downsides to relying on autoload, but, on a more prosaic note, it poses problems for multi-threaded applications. Matz himself has said that autoload might be dropped in Ruby 3.0 for this reason.

item.title: Suggestion from Filip Kostovski (@sirfilip)
item.description: I dont think that autoloading should be dropped. I have php experience where autolading is used very much to provide IoC container, speed up (reduce loading of files that are not required) etc.
